data.title: century Israeli women writers
data.text:
Overview: Dvora Omer (Hebrew: דבורה עומר‎; October 9, 1932 – May 2, 2013) was an Israeli author.

Date of birth: 9 October 1932

Date of death: 2 May 2013

Age: 80 (age at death)

Nationality: Israeli

Occupation: Novelist

Gender: Female

Overview: Yona Wallach (Hebrew: יונה וולך‎; June 10, 1944 – September 26, 1985) was an Israeli poet. Her surname also appears as Volach. She is considered a revolutionary Israeli feminist and post-modernist ...

Date of death: 29 September 1985

Nationality: Israeli

Occupation: Poet

Gender: Female

Overview: Naomi Shemer (Hebrew: נעמי שמר‎; July 13, 1930 – June 26, 2004) was a leading Israeli musician and songwriter, hailed as the "first lady of Israeli song and poetry." Her song "Yerushalayim Shel Zahav" ...

Date of birth: 13 July 1930

Date of death: 26 June 2004

Age: 73 (age at death)

Nationality: Israeli

Occupation: Composer

Gender: Female

Overview: Naomi Ragen (Hebrew: נעמי רגן‎; born July 10, 1949) is an American-Israeli modern-Orthodox Jewish author and playwright. Ragen lives in Jerusalem, and writes in English. A recurring theme in her ...

Occupation: Writer

Overview: Leigh Bardugo (Hebrew: לי ברדוגו‎) is an Israeli-American young adult and fantasy author. She is best known for her Grishaverse novels, which include the Six of Crows duology, the Grisha trilogy ...

Nationality: American

Occupation: Novelist

Gender: Female

Overview: Judith Hemmendinger (October 2, 1923 – March 24, 2024) was a German-born Israeli researcher and author specializing in child survivors of the Holocaust. During World War II, she was a social worker and ...

Overview: Ruth Amiran (Hebrew: רות עמירן‎; 1914 – December 14, 2005), née Brandstetter, was an Israeli archaeologist whose book Ancient Pottery of the Holy Land: From Its Beginnings in the Neolithic Period ...
